author: Internet Desk
title: Edappadi Palaniswami wins floor test
text:
February 18, 2017 15:28  29 IST more-in 
The floor test in the Tamil Nadu Assembly confirmed Chief Minister Edappadi K. Palaniswami's confidence motion on Saturday. 
Speaker Dhanapal said the confidence motion got 122 votes in favour. 
After former Chief Minister O. Panneerselvam declared on February 7 that he had been forced to resign by AIADMK interim general secretary V.K. Sasikala, the party split up into two camps â€” one on the former Chief Minister's side and the other supporting Sasikala. 
Governor Ch. Vidyasagar Rao, after Sasikala was convicted by the Supreme Court in a disproportionate assets case, invited Mr. Palaniswami, nominated by Sasikala, to form the government. Two days after the swearing in ceremony on February 16, the Chief Minister moved a confidence motion in the House. 
The confidence motion, however was not a smooth affair. 
The House had to be adjourned twice as the Panneerselvam faction and opposition MLAs demanded secret ballot, which was rejected by the Speaker.
